Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardList
      • Hand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Flush, FullHouse, Pair, Quad, Single, Straight, StraightFlush, Triple
    public abstract class Hand
extends CardList
    The Hand public class is a subclass of CardList .It models the hand of cards and has private instance variables storing the cards played and methods which check if the played hand is valid, gets the type of hand and also gets the top card
    Author:
    Rishabh
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Hand​(CardGamePlayer player, CardList cards)
      Constructor that helps in modeling specific player's hand and list of cards

      • Hand

        public Hand​(CardGamePlayer player,
            CardList cards)
        Constructor that helps in modeling specific player's hand and list of cards
        Parameters:

        cards - CardList object containing list of cards played

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayer

        public CardGamePlayer getPlayer()
        Method used to retrieving the player of the active hand
        Returns:
        CardGamePlayer player containing the active player

      • getTopCard

        public Card getTopCard()
        Method for retrieving top card of the current hand. It is overridden by subclasses
        Returns:
        null in Hand class otherwise a card in subclasses

      • beats

        public boolean beats​(Hand hand)
        Method used for checking if the current hand beats the last hand
        Parameters:
        hand - hand to check if it is beaten
        Returns:
        true if the current hand beats the last hand else false

      • isValid

        public abstract boolean isValid()
        Method used to check if the particular hand is a valid hand or not
        Returns:
        true or false whether hand is of the particular type

      • getType

        public abstract java.lang.String getType()
        Method to get the type of the Hand
        Returns:
        a string which states type of the particular hand.
